Overall LGTM, with some small comments and nice to have. Please have other reviewers review too.
@junkaixue Was there any reason why the operation timeout is Integer.MAX? Is there any case we know that may exceed that?
This test fails in: https://github.com/apache/helix/actions/runs/3579136671
This test fails in: https://github.com/apache/helix/actions/runs/3579136671
This test fails in: https://github.com/apache/helix/actions/runs/3579156879
I cannot remember why it set to int max. Maybe because it was timeout within the same session? @jiajunwang

> I cannot remember why it set to int max. Maybe because it was timeout within the same session? @jiajunwang

It was not a purely technical decision. I think keeping retrying still makes sense for the control plane components. But for end users, a reasonable timeout is better.

Thanks @jiajunwang and @junkaixue for your comments. The rational behind reducing this default timeout is that 25 days is way too much timeout for any operation to retry IMHO. Even 1 day is long one but still it is reasonable in some sense, in reality I'm hoping that end users will override this by few mins timeout value. Let me know if that makes sense.

I don't have any concern regarding the change. Just to provide some more context:

One question we discussed before is what to do if the operation is timed out?
If users are going to manually retry anyway, then just keep retrying seems to be a reasonable choice.
Actually inside Helix control plane, retrying is the only option, IMHO.
In other systems, the timeout error state does not necessarily stop the retry process. But it seems to be too complicated for Helix.
Review has been completed - I will proceed to merge this into a feature branch. The feature branch will merge back into master after tests and metrics are added.
I have another solution that I will send a PR for shortly that should fix this in a cleaner way.
Here's the PR with the proper fix: https://github.com/apache/helix/pull/2303
Thanks for the fix. Could you please make a dummy change in other module outside helix-front just to trigger a CI build? E.g. an empty line in helix-core pom.xml will do. Thanks

Also, please follow our PR merge template: https://github.com/apache/helix/wiki/Pull-Request-Description-Template. Current description is too short to cover everything.

Quincy's PR is a very good example for this: https://github.com/apache/helix/pull/2301
@BoyuLi4 Thanks for the contributing. Please make sure follow the merge steps to confirm this PR is ready to merge: https://github.com/apache/helix/wiki/Pull-Request-Merge-Steps
Please make sure your mvn test result pasted in the description.
Please make sure the PR follow the PR template including descriptions, linked issues and paste test results: https://github.com/apache/helix/wiki/Pull-Request-Description-Template

@junkaixue, you may have missed it, but for the past two months we have had a [helix-front specific PR template](https://github.com/apache/helix/blob/master/.github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE/helix_front.md). This PR follows that template.
This PR is ready to be merged.

Commit message:
Remove the revision variable from all pom.xml and update scripts accordingly.

> If i understood correctly, you reduced the scope of 'synchronized' by making 2 variables 'volatile' and checking against it. Code changes looks good to me.

@desaikomal Yes, it's double-checked locking. This reduces the overhead of obtaining the lock if the variable has been created.

It looks like some Apache Github org-level configuration is preventing this otherwise good Github action and Github workflow from running:

https://github.com/apache/helix/actions/runs/3665155211

`Error: .github#L1
bahmutov/npm-install@v1 is not allowed to be used in apache/helix. Actions in this workflow must be: within a repository owned by apache, created by GitHub, verified in the GitHub Marketplace, or matching the following: */*@[a-f0-9][a-f0-9][a-f0-9][a-f0-9][a-f0-9][a-f0-9][a-f0-9]+, AdoptOpenJDK/install-jdk@*, JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action@5dc1d5a192aeb5ab5b7d5a77b7d36aea4a7f5c92, TobKed/label-when-approved-action@*, actions-cool/issues-helper@*, actions-rs/*, al-cheb/configure-pagefile-action@*, amannn/action-semantic-pull-request@*, apache/*, burrunan/gradle-cache-action@*, bytedeco/javacpp-presets/.github/actions/*, chromaui/action@*, codecov/codecov-action@*, conda-incubator/setup-miniconda@*, container-tools/kind-action@*, container-tools/microshift-action@*, dawidd6/action-download-artifact@*, delaguardo/setup-graalvm@*, docker://jekyll/jekyll:*, docker://pandoc/core:2.9, eps1lon/actions-label-merge-conflict@*, gaurav-nelson/github-action-markdown-link-check@*, golangci/...`
https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/25129

The Github Action `bahmutov/npm-install` is the most popular Github Action on the Github Marketplace of its kind. It is widely used and safe to add to the Apache Github org's allow-list.  https://github.com/marketplace/actions/npm-or-yarn-install-with-caching

To resolve this issue, we need to ask an admin of the Apache Github org to allow-list `bahmutov/npm-install` in the list show in the error message. 

Who is an Apache Github org admin, and how do we contact them?

How to find or contact an owner of an organization?
https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/22104
> You cannot find this information, only GitHub staff (and organization members) can. You could try contacting the GitHub support team and see whether they can help you.
@junkaixue Do you know who administers the Apache Github org?

https://www.apache.org/foundation/contact.html

This page doesn't list a contact email address for the Apache Github Org, rather it lists many specific projects.

of 1?

Best Regards,
Jiajun

Code looks good to me. Please make sure you run the helix-front module tests and paste the test results in the description section.

@jiajunwang missed your message: yes we will count 2 times. Conceptually, given that these pipelines are separate async pipelines now, counting 2 times does make sense (rebalance failed on 2 occasions with possibly different settings). Operationally, since the metric is used to indicate errors, counting 2 times is mostly similar to counting 1 time (and definitely better than counting 0 times).
Agreed. Not a concern.

Thanks reviewers.  Here are the test results, which are also pasted in the description. As soon as #2305 is fixed, we will run this test suite in CI here as well.

Commit message:
Implement double-checked locking in AssignmentMetadataStore for better performance.
Could you please elaborate a little bit why the double locking helps improvement the performance?

> Could you please elaborate a little bit why the double locking helps improvement the performance?
@junkaixue 
This is a common pattern to reduce the overhead of obtaining lock, there is no need to synchronize on the instance if the variable has been created. See https://www.baeldung.com/java-singleton-double-checked-locking and https://stackoverflow.com/questions/17164454/why-double-checked-locking-is-25-faster-in-joshua-bloch-effective-java-example
(I'll link this to the description as well)

> Thanks reviewers. Here are the test results, which are also pasted in the description. As soon as #2305 is fixed, we will run this test suite in CI here as well.
> 
> ```
> > Test run finished at 12/12/2022, 6:28:14 PM <
> 
> Test Suites: 9 skipped, 35 passed, 35 of 44 total
> Tests:       10 skipped, 38 passed, 48 total
> Snapshots:   0 total
> Time:        10.462 s
> Ran all test suites.
> ```

Thank you for running the tests. Do we know why there are failed tests? Can they be fixed?

Hi @mgao0, thank you for the review. We should clarify: there are no failed tests. The 10 skipped tests were skipped by the original author @hivivo 5 years ago. Here is a [git blame](https://github.com/apache/helix/blame/master/helix-front/src/app/cluster/cluster-detail/cluster-detail.component.spec.ts#L28) link that shows an example of this old, unchanged skip command. This PR does not change those old skip commands. The specific skip command used by @hivivo in the old commits is the `xit()` alias for `test.skip(name, fn)` from the unit testing library jest: https://jestjs.io/docs/api#testskipname-fn
